verses.text: In the second year of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel, Amaziah son of Joash, king of Judah, began to reign.
He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jehoaddin of Jerusalem.
verses.comment: Standard regnal details, see parallel in 2 Chronicles.

verses.text: He did what was right in the sight of the LORD, yet not like his father David. He did everything as Joash his father had done.
verses.comment: Note distinction: not fully faithful like David.

verses.text: However, the high places were not removed; the people still sacrificed and burned incense on the high places.
verses.comment: Consistent issue: high places not abolished.

verses.text: When the kingdom was firmly in his hand, he killed his servants who had struck down the king his father.
verses.comment: Refers back to the assassination of his father Joash.

verses.text: But the sons of the murderers he did not put to death, according to what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses—where the LORD commanded, 'Fathers shall not be put to death because of their children, nor shall children be put to death because of their fathers; each one shall die for his own sin.'
verses.comment: Cites Deuteronomy as his basis and restraint.

verses.text: He struck down ten thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt, and captured Sela in battle. He called it Joktheel, which is its name to this day.
verses.comment: Valley of Salt: site of previous victories (cf. David).

verses.text: Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, 'Come, let us face each other in battle.'
Jehoash king of Israel sent a reply to Amaziah king of Judah: 'A thistle in Lebanon sent to a cedar in Lebanon, saying,
"You have indeed defeated Edom, and your heart has lifted you up. Enjoy your glory and stay at home. Why should you provoke trouble so that you fall and Judah with you?"
verses.comment: Jehoash warns Amaziah about pride after his victory.

verses.text: But Amaziah would not listen. So Jehoash king of Israel went up, and he and Amaziah king of Judah faced each other at Beth-shemesh, which belongs to Judah.
Judah was defeated by Israel, and every man fled to his tent.

Jehoash king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, son of Joash, son of Ahaziah, at Beth-shemesh. Then he came to Jerusalem and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the Gate of Ephraim to the Corner Gate, a section four hundred cubits long.
He took all the gold and silver and all the vessels found in the house of the LORD and in the treasuries of the king’s palace, including hostages, and returned to Samaria.
Now the rest of the acts of Jehoash that he did, his might, and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
And Jehoash rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. Then Jeroboam his son became king in his place.
Amaziah the son of Joash, king of Judah, lived fifteen years after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel.
Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
verses.comment: Standard formula for further reading source.

verses.text: They conspired against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish. But they sent men after him to Lachish, and killed him there.
They carried him on horses, and he was buried in Jerusalem with his fathers in the city of David.
All the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah.
verses.comment: Notable as Azariah (Uzziah) begins reign early.

verses.text: He rebuilt Elath and restored it to Judah after the king slept with his fathers.
verses.comment: Elath was a strategic city (Red Sea port).

verses.text: In the fifteenth year of Amaziah son of Joash, king of Judah, Jeroboam son of Jehoash, king of Israel, began to reign in Samaria; he reigned forty-one years.
He did evil in the sight of the LORD. He did not turn away from all the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who made Israel sin.
verses.comment: The sin of Jeroboam refers to golden calf worship.

verses.text: He restored the border of Israel from Lebo-hamath as far as the Sea of the Arabah, according to the word of the LORD, the God of Israel, which he spoke by his servant Jonah son of Amittai, the prophet, from Gath-hepher.
verses.comment: Only occurrence of Jonah outside of the book of Jonah.

verses.text: For the LORD saw that the affliction of Israel was very bitter; there was no one left, neither slave nor free, nor any helper for Israel.
verses.comment: Emphasizes Israel's dire state before restoration.

verses.text: But the LORD had not said he would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven; so he delivered them by the hand of Jeroboam son of Jehoash.

Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his might—how he fought and how he regained Damascus and Hamath for Judah in Israel—are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
And Jeroboam slept with his fathers, the kings of Israel, and Zechariah his son became king in his place.
